text: Pours a black color with no head. Mostly bourbon aroma. Slick mouth feel. Sugary. Tobacco. Coconut. Bourbon. Very boozy. Licorice once warm.

22oz (Guys Night)- Midnight black with lacing leaving quickly. Lots and lots of coconut and vanilla in nose. Same in the taste... really sweet and chocolatey but very very boozy. Too heavy and sweet.

Bomber via trade. This is for you Dude.
Brune foncée, col beige.
Arôme au nez malté, Bourbon perce très bien en rétro avec de fines effluves de vanille. Pointe de biscuité et café également à noter.
Palais est malté, biscuité qcq notes de fruits noirs avec une douceur de sucre résiduel rappelant le sirop dérable voire la cane à sucre. Amertume modérée de houblons perce en retrait. Pas mal de chaleur venant des 15% avec un léger côté de spéculoos, au final, sympa, Bourbon joue son rôle, mais le tout reste trop doux même partagée à plusieurs.

Draft in a snifter. Chocolate brown with small tan head. Hint of booze on the nose but mostly chocolate and coconut. Surprisingly smooth. Palate has bourbon, chocolate, coconut, vanilla, espresso, molasses, and more. 

It was excellent but the 6 ounces I had was enough for me.

Pours a thick black from the bottle with bubbly tan brown head that dissipates to leave light lace. Aroma of deep roasted coffee notes and nice sweetened condensed milk middle that falls to vanilla and booze. Taste is even more of the Vietnamese coffee for sure, with good barrel notes behind, booze and barrel. Flavors are spot on, its just a bit big for me.

22oz bottle. Black with a thin ring of tan foam. Flavors are roasted cereals, brown sugar, coconut, vanilla, bourbon and chocolate. Full body, soft to moderate carbonation, oily texture. Overly sweet.

Pours very dark brown. Small white head. Smell is full, bitbsweet, very hidden coconut. Taste is full, intense grainy notes, silky coconut subtile touches. So nice balance ! Def on the sweet side, nice !

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshare goodbye Aaron edition (or not?). Thick oily black pour with a dark tan head. Notes of sweeeeeeet sugar, some coconut, cinnamon, syrupy, vanilla and light roast. A bit cloying but good anyways.

Bottle 22fl.oz. @ [ Klimaet Cellar Clearance Tasting ], Aarhus, Denmark. [ As Perrin No Rules Vietnamese Porter ].Clear dark brown colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, coconut, alcohol, bourbon, cacao - candy, bounty, light vanilla. Flavor is heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, cacao - candy, chocolate, sweet malt, coconut, bounty. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20170203]
 8-4-9-4-17
Dark beer with a thin beige head. Great buttery bourbon nose with lots of alcohol. Incredibly rich beer with tons of chocolate, sweet coconut, bourbon, roasted grains. Very sweet but very delicious.
Cudowna wanilia i kokos w aromacie. Mega słodkie,oblepiające. Kokos, czekolada, wanilia, likier kokosowy/czekoladowy, cudnie ukryte alko.

Rami Rami is drinking a No Rules Vietnamese Porter (2015) by Perrin Brewing Co. at Chmielarnia Marszałkowska

Kokos, lukrecja, wanilia, #teamcukrzuca, ale w elitarnym i zajebistym wydaniu. Przyprawy, cielistosc spoko ale za malo. Ekstraklasa.

From bottle thanks to Bursprak at Dangerous Bottleshares - See You In August Aaron Edition! Pours blackish with a medium small beige-ish head. Aroma has sweet milk chocolate, light coconut, brown sugar, roasty malts, heavy bourbon, malt syrup. Taste is very sweet, but has a rather high roasty bitterness to balance it. Pretty boozy, full, sticky body, low carb. Very sugary, but nice!

Dangerous bottle share goodbye Aaron edition. Pours black with a beige head, Aroma of coconut, brown sugar, sweet bourbon, vanilla, sweet chocolate, buttery and slight spices. Taste is very sweet with a lot of coconut, brown sugar, vanilla, sweet bourbon, buttery, sweet chocolate and marshmallows. Pretty sweet indeed bit this is bomb!

Bottle from Ian (I think). Dark brown with a thin head. Wow what a sweet cloying boozy nose...lots of coconut, vanilla, a bit of soy, some oak, chocolate, brown sugar, caramel. Thick, full body, mild carbonation, incredibly sweet, long finish.

Dark brown color with tan head. Aroma is mostly malty and sugary with a hint of toasted coconut. Taste starts with overly sweet coconut syrup, a hint of earthy bitterness towards the finish but still overpowered by the sugary sweetness. Full bodied, sticky feel. Overall it has some nice flavors but its way too sweet.

Bottle shared at a tasting. Dark caramel pour with a thin tan head. Tons of sugar, caramel, vanilla and coconut notes. The flavour is there, but the beer is too sweet, making it a bit too hard to drink.
The wonderful, rich aroma is obliterated by the cloying flavor. Almost undrinkable. Way too sweet.

Refrigerated brown bomber poured into a glass. Black with opaque with small beige head. Aroma is light coffee, medium/thick body, medium/light carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is really nice coffee, malty, chocolate, and a little coconut.

DOB: ?2015 BJCP Category: 33B Specialty Wood-Aged Beer (base style: 20A American Porter)
AROMA: Intense vanilla and sugary sweetness. Strong bourbon and wood character from the barrel. Very sweet nose with sight cinnamon-like spicy presence. Plenty of dark malt. No distinct hops. 8/12APPEARANCE: Inky opaque black. Small dark tan foam retains well for the ABV. 2/3FLAVOR: Highly sweet vanilla is the dominate flavor with chocolate and coconut emerging briefly. There is gentle bitterness and a slight cinnamon-like spice (but no hop flavor per se). Bourbon and wood flavors are consistently in the background along with a strong boozy taste and warmth. Finishes with a cherry cough syrup or Dr. Pepper flavor that lingers momentarily. Hard to discern any specialty or roasted malt; just a general dark maltiness. Though tasty, it is cloying and unbalanced. 14/20MOUTHFEEL: Full-bodied with low carbonation. Smooth texture with alcohol heat that is difficult to ignore. The 15% ABV is impossible to overlook and makes the beer a sipper. Sugary/medicine-like aftertaste is tolerable. 2/5OVERALL IMPRESSION: Though enjoyable, its unapologetically unbalanced and cloying. Nice for a few ounces only. 6/10TOTAL SCORE: 32/50

22 ounce bottle, 2016 vintage. Served in a DFH snifter, the beer pours dark brown/black with about a half inch tan head that didnt stay around for too long. Theres a small amount of lacing. Aroma is nice and sweet, the brew smells like chocolate, coconut, vanilla, bourbon, brown sugar and a bit of coffee. Taste is similar to the aroma, it tastes like coconut, chocolate, molasses, brown sugar, vanilla, bourbon, nuts, and some coffee. Kinda reminds me of an Almond Joy bar. Mostly sweet but the barrel character isnt strong, Im guessing the overall sweetness of this beer just overpowers everything else. Mouthfeel/body is medium/full, its coating with a moderate amount of carbonation. I liked this overall, but if you dont care for really sweet tasting brews then you might want to pass on it. $14.99 a bomber.
It pours dark brown with a tan head. It has a full rich body with mild carbonation. The taste has coconut, chocolate, sweetness, with roast and light caramel. This is pretty amazing.
Smooth milk chocolate and coconut flavors. Alcohol is hidden really well. Big viscous mouth feel.

From a bomber. Pours an inky brown, black and makes a thin dark tan head. Aroma is of chocolate liqueur and coconut. Tastes of sweet turbinado sugar, chocolate, and rum. Oh my goodness this is a sweet explosion of a beer. Yum. Great with dessert. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Really incredible beer, but then the 15% aged beers out of a tap always are. The bourbon barrel aged whatevers are routinely amazing. I had this at a Pho restaurant, they said it was like a Vietnamese coffee, and I cant lie, it sort of is. Turbanado sugar, eh? All I know is this has completely changed my idea of a porter, if all porters were like this Id be all over that genre/medium of beer, versus its more famous cousin, the stout. 
Perrin does a great job, really impressive beer, hits the spot in winter. Could have had three glasses of this. Of course then I would have wanted to party! I bought their Lil-Griz based on this success, which I will now review.

22 oz. bottle via trade. Pours a dark brown, not quite opaque on the pour but deeper when in the glass. Small tan head, creamy in texture, settling into a lasting film and ring, leaving a good amount of lace in the glass. Notes of sugars, vanilla, toasted coconut, oak, tobacco, molasses, chocolate, cream, candied nuts, marshmallow, bourbon, raisins, and dates. Medium-full bodied, with moderate to medium carbonation and an intensely sweet mouthfeel. Theres some booziness to it, but more in the aroma than the flavor. The flavor brings more sweetness than the nose, and the sugary sweetness hits the palate in waves. Its a fun beer and very good, but a bit too sweet to be elite.

Aromas of coconut rum, Hersheys milk chocolate syrup, bourbon, some faint espresso. Taste is coconut,sweet condensed milk, sweet milk chocolate, bourbon (I personally would like more of the bourbon flavor to show to balance the sweetness). There are some espresso like notes in the finish, but they are very subtle. Very sweet chocolate milk finish with more bourbon coming through.

Merci à Alexandre pour le partage! Ce nest pas tous les jours que lon boit des trucs semblables, et je présume que cest tant mieux. Belle robe sombre et grasse qui produit une mousse bien abondante pour les 15% dalcool. À partir de là, tout est totalement décadent. Un festival de noix de coco, de café, de chocolat au lait, de lait chocolaté. La puissance du sucre et du chocolat est telle que la barrique passe totalement au second plan. Il faut fournir de réels efforts pour noter sa présence tant elle est noyée dans cet ouragan de sucre qui me rappelle le glaçage à beigne. Dans tout cela, lalcool demeure parfaitement dissimulé. Parfois il faut se faire violence pour apprécier la douceur des autres bières. Je considère mêtre battu à mort.

At the 2017 Super Bowl Bottleshare. Black, with nice beige foam. Smell like coffee adn milk chocolate, with a hint of bourbon. Taste seems is a bit more vanilla forward, with plent of coffee and chocolate. Hint of red wine in the finish.

Bottle shared at Ratebeer awards show. 30/01/2016. Huge thanks! An opaque black / dark brown coloured pour with a halo of light tan head. Aroma is a nice mix of marzipan, vanilla, cherry bakwell, hints of smooth roast anf choc. Flavour is composed of vanilla, cranberry, salty roast, . Palate is medium full, creamy, highish smooth carbonation. Good Stuff.

THANK YOU! Bomber sampled. Black with zero head. Nose is astonishing pure chocolate & brownie sludge sweetness, sweet coffee, very sweet bourbon chocolate pralines, hazelnut, ridiculous old school RIS bourbon desert sweetness. Taste is slightly bitter upfront, not necessary but it works for me, some light black chocolate bitterness upfront leading into brownie dough, sweet chocolate, mocha, pralines, faint coconut, very sweet bourbon. This I love, body is all syrup, 15 % ABV doesnt show. "The Big Lebowski" reference is just gravy on top.

draft that pours an oily black. no head no lacing. the aroma is huge coconut and I want to say coconut extract booze at a mere 15% this is a slow sipper. deep dark roasted malts and chocolate malts, again if its not coconut extract I am sorry and huge booze flavor. the warmer the better and a little goes along way.

Pours a surprisingly clear and light cola brown with an even more surprising pale beige foam. Kinda worrying but lets get to it. Nose: alright now big whiffs of coconut and chocolate cookies. Not getting too much barrel but coconut is there big time. Piña colada ish.. Taste: big and rich. Again the sweet coconut rules supreme. Candied stuff and booze. Somewhat artificial flavours but it tastes good. Mouthfeel is medium, texture is medium rich and the aftertaste is endless. Good beer.

Bottle. Aroma of chocolate, coconut, bourbon. Dark brown with mostly lasting tan head. Taste is huge bourbon, chocolately coffee, heavy sweet, sweet coconut. Full body, thick feel, sweet bourbon finish

Bottle @ "Klimaet Cellar Clearance", 15%. Very dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, candy and coconut. Flavour is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, coconut, sweet, warming, little liquorice, vanilla, candy, hop and a little bitter.

Bottle. Pours dark reddish brown/black with a medium creamy light brown head. Aromas of coconut, vanilla, dark fruits, milk chocolate, brown sugar. Taste is milky chocolate, huge vanilla, bourbon, fudge, coconut, caramel, dark fruits. Faaaawk

Klimaet cellar clearance. Pours very dark brown with a brown head, light lacings. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, coconut, wood, vanilla, bourbon. Flavor is sweet, malty, caramel, coconut, vanilla, wood, bourbon. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, sweet finish with some warming alcohol. Alcohol is keept well in control for the 15% ABV. 030217

Bottle @ Klimaet Cellar Clearance. Black with a brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, coffee, coconut and bourbon. Flavor is very sweet and rather bitter. Sweet and rather bitter finish with lots of warming alcohol. Oily. 030217
Bottle. Nice creamy head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are coconut, roast malt, chocolate, vanilla, bourbon and has a sweet chocolate, bourbon finish.

Bomber to snifter. Deep reddish brown pour with thin tan head that fades quick. Nose is super sweet, vanilla, brown sugar, some spice, booze, very nice. Surprising body with light carbonation. Flavors follow nose, sweet but not too much, sugar comes through much more than coconut, bourbon comes out the more it sits but never overpowering. Really glad I picked this up. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours deep brown with a medium brown head which soon recedes. Aroma is toasted coconut and a hint of sugary pineapple. Taste is toasted coconut, cocoa bitter, chocolate sweet, vanilla sweet, hint of sweet vanilla sweet. Fluffy body.

From a bomber into a snifter. Pours very dark brown wit small light brown head. Nose is candied fruit, spices, cinnamon, star anise, vanilla, bourbon. Really nice nose. Thick body, very very sweet, low carbonation, oily. Long hot finish, this where some of the coconut comes through. Great flavors and intense, but just too sweet for my palate.

Tasted from draft. Incredible intense aroma of chocolate, coffee, bourbon, vanilla. Taste with similar flavors along with caramel, cinnamon, spices. Very syrupy and clingy mouthfeel. Mild alcohol burn finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 oz bomber pours dark black with head and mild lacing, which is expected for this big porter. Coconut and vanilla aroma. Dark black color. Sweet brown sugar finish with coconut and slight vanilla aftertaste. Everything I expected from this world class rated porter.

Style et résumé: Imperial porter.
Comment: Dégustation Manseau 2016. 
Portrait:  Une robe brune foncée comme il se doit. Un nez bien agréable de chocolat. Une bouche crémeuse avec des saveurs de chocolat à la limite de chocolat au lait. Touche de bourbon. Cest très bon. Jaime cette texture.
Note:  7+/10

Bottle share @ Hampton Inn pre-DLD 2016. Pour is deep brown with a very small off-white head. Notes of sweet coconut, bourbon, brown sugar, booze, vanilla, and cane sugar. Finish is very sweet with a touch of booze.

22 oz bomber. Pours dark brown / black with a very small tan head that quickly goes to a thin collar that leaves a little lacing.

The aroma is sweet chocolate and coconut with some dark fruit and roast and a bourbon alcohol finish.

The flavor is lots of sweet sugary chocolate malt and coconut with lots of boozy fruitcake. The mouthfeel is medium bodied with no carbonation and is a bit watery.

Overall, it improves as it warms but its too sweet and boozy for me.

Fresh batch #2. Deep oily black. Nose is vanilla, creme brulee, some light coffee, dark roast malts. Taste is quite sweet, almost cloying. Very rich. Flavor follows nose with creamy mouthfeel, lots of vanilla and creme brulee. Like a southern tier creme brulee stout. Little bit goes a loooong way.

Deep heavy brown pour under a thin light tan cap. Amazing aroma with bourbon and oak and brown sugar with a big dose of toasted coconut and vanilla with deep roasty cocoa stout tones. Huge palate with sweet dark chocolate, a blast of toasted coconut, vanilla bean, and a wallop of bourbon and oak char and brown sugar on a boozy bourbon finish. Amazing.

Pours black with small brown head. Aromas of malt and coconut. Taste the same with a little sweetness and a big alcohol burn. Definitely a sipping beer. Thick mouth feel almost like motor oil. Very nice. Very complex flavor can taste chocolate and coconut and some caramel. Nice lacing. But take it easy this beer is huge!

Bottle. Pours black notmuch head. Smells coconut and sugar. Huge smell. Palate is thick and creamy. The taste is huge! Big coconut. Big spcinnamon. Then a bourbon sweet after burn. Holy cow what an awesome porter. Best porter I have had in a long time. Well done!!

Draft. Poured black color with an average frothy brown head that mostly lasted with fair lacing. Moderate to heavy roasted malt, chocolate, coconut, wood, and dark alcohol aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy roasted malt, coconut and alcohol flavor with a medium to heavy dark sweet smooth alcohol burn finish of moderate to long duration. This is a standout beer.

Bottle:
Pours almost black....with a faint wisp of a tan ring.
Chocolate fudge, cherry, bourbon aroma.
Super-rich....chocolate malt, molasses, coconut, mild bourbon taste.
Very sweet.....sticky and rich.
You wouldnt believe its 15%.....(Im not sure I do).....
That said...Its really, really tasty!

Bomber from Savor Growl: black pour, beige ring. aroma of sweet, dark malt, coconut. tastes are sugary sweet, molasses, candied, bourbon, cola vibe, coconut, chocolate, cinnamon, toffee - lots happening. its warm, but covers %15 extremely well. way too sweet for my tastes, but deserved reputation overall. this would be a good desert beer in small portions.

22 ounce bottle from flandersned. Thanks! The beer is a thick black color with a khaki head that diminishes quickly. In the aroma there are strong coffee notes, some boozy attributes, big roast. Reminds me a lot of a vietnamese coffee, which I think is the idea. Very sweet. Big body and moderate carbonation levels. Awesome beer.

Bottle 22oz.
Pours dark brown with low beige head. Aroma is of coconut, roasted malt, alcohol. Taste is of coconut, roasted malt, sugar. Palate: Full bodied. Soft carbonation. Overall: Good stuff.

Tap Pour at local BA Tap Takeover - black with no head to speak of, and I guess Id simply use the word still to describe this beer. Aroma is spicy...full of cinnamon...sweet malt, lightly toasted coconut and some chocolate - inviting and very nicely done. Flavor is simply impressive - the cinnamon is sharp and beautiful on this drink...loads of sweet, mildly roasted malt...coconut on the edges, mild bourbon presence - sublime stuff! Palate is quite good as well - as expected thick and oily, but surprisingly easy drinking...nearly zero carbonation, but that seems perfectly acceptable here. Had a number of good beers on this evening, and this one was the cream of the crop - one of the better beers Ive had in quite some time!

To snifter. Boasting a pure black body and a small ring of head along the glass, I can already smell this brew. Served at a handful of degrees shy of room temp. Nose is coconut-heavy and fudgy, first and foremost. Some spicy brown sugar notes appear vibrantly, with very Mexican-chocolate notes and mocha essences. Actually an extremely dessert-like nose. Beautifully aromatic. The flavor boasts a noticeable hotness with very sweet cinnamon and brown sugar, definitely not a dry porter to say the least. The turninado, cinnamon, and vanilla from the oak add a profound dessert-like quality to this beer. With a fairly slick, full body and ephemeral carbonation, this brew is quite confusing. I cant tell whether I love or hate it. To say the least, its a "dessert beer". Spiced, sugary, oaked, a perfect after-dinner beer to lull you into a lovely fuzziness of a buzz. At this point, I am torn. I hate sweet wines/beers, but this one has the edge of winning me over. Warming, somehow nostalgic flavors, really perfect for these winter months ahead. Confused and consumed by this brew, I let it appear as it.

22 oz bottle shared, purchased at Mile High Wine & Spirits. Thick and black appearance with a small, dissipating brown head. Aroma of coconut, chocolate malt, burnt sugar, roasted grain and light coffee/espresso. Similar flavor, rich and sweet with a full body. A nice sipper, it made for an excellent dessert beer.

Pours solid dark brown with almost no head. Aroma of caramel and vanilla. Flavor is brown sugar and vanilla...sweet. Some fermentation notes and a long aftertaste of sweet soy. I kind of like it. After a KBS, black butte xviii. Nice dessert.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2016 Bottle thanks to Joe. Pours dark brown with good light penetration around the fringe. No head. Hickory and oak and dark chocolate nose. Viscous mouthfeel, solid coffee flavor slightly acrid. This has a great sweetness that in addition to the viscosity helps it match what I think of as being cafe sua da

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2016 651 ml. bottle. Pours a medium rapidly collapsing beige head, with minimal lacing, over a clear dark brown (SRM 28) body......nose is roasted malts with chocolate, cocoa, brown sugar, light molasses, mild bourbon, heavy coconut, no hops......taste is brown sugar, molasses sweet, with multiple dried fruits including fig, raisin, moderate chocolate, all from the malts and turbinado, also coconut, and heavy bourbon and slight vanilla, mild tobacco tones, mild nuttiness, finishing with lingering sweetness.....mouth feel, heavy sticky body, alcohol heat lightly present, carbonation low. This is rich, thick, very sweet, highly complex beer. The alcohol at 15% is slightly subdued due to the heavy sugar and malt contribution. This is a cold weather beer, because of the high sweetness and alcohol and light similarity to pecan pie being had with a glass of bourbon. BJCP 9/2/16/4/7

Pours a very dark brown with a beige rim on top that leaves restricted lacing. Nose is of vanilla, chocolate and cake batter. You get a big booze kick from the get go with more chocolate and vanilla. Just too intense. Body is full, carbonation moderate and it is hot hot hot. Not bad but I cant see myself drinking more than the 2oz I have in front of me right now.

Bouteille 650ml, bottle share. Couleur noire opaque, mousse moka aérée. Arôme de malt torréfié, Bourbon, sucré, sauce soya, noix de coco, vanille. Goût très sucré, sauce soy, café, vanille. Carbonatation faible, corps dense.

bottle at toms epic tasting 2016. pours unclear very dark brown with a small beige cap offering some retention and lacing. vanilla roastiness, tingling hot peppers, molasses sweetness, vanillin, its of spices. moderately low carbonation, medium to full body - oily; sweet and spicy finish. sweet with loads of vanilla. nah.

Aroma of bourbon, coconut, vanilla, caramel, toffee, espresso, booze. Taste is boozy, bourbon, coconut, toffee, leather, light balanced highly roasted coffee. Really boozy, and sweet, not very drinkable, thin boozy body.

Bottle (22 oz), shared. Dark brown witha small off-white head leaving little lacing. Aroma is of vanilla, bourbon, coconut, alcohol, brown sugar and mild spiciness. Taste is sweet and boozy with coconut, bourbon, brown sugar, alcohol, vanilla and sweet finish. Full body. Soft carbonation. Oily mouthfeel. Overly sweet but flavorful.

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2016 Bouteille. Robe noire opaque avec de minces reflets noisettes. Léger cerne de mousse. Arômes de chocolat noir, vanille, butterscotch, eau de coco. En bouche, chocolat noir, vanille et sucre résiduel trop présent. Également touche boisée, miel sauvage, purée de dattes, noix de coco. Texture huileuse et corps trop rond et trop lourd.

Bottle shared. Opaque black pour with thin ring of tan foam. Aroma is super sweet, roasty, intense malty sweet notes. Taste is sweet, very sweet, brown sugar, vanilla, super sticky, nice molasses. Palate is very sweet, heavy. Good.
Vanille, noix de coco, sucre obèse. Au goût, cest trop intense. Il y a une tonne de sucre et aucune subtilité. Difficile à boire. Chaude en tabarnouche. Une bière dessert de trop. Non merci.

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2016 Drank again: drank during tasting. I find it as sweet as before. Taste is on the medicinal notes a bit too. Old rating: 650ml bottle shared with brother. Aroma: strong coconut, chocolate, vanilla. App: dark brown, minimal mocha head leaving little lacing. Taste and palate: full body, high sweetness, moderate bitter and sweet finish. Overall: this is way too sweet. Not a beer for diabetes! They would probably die after the first sip. I?m glad I had this beer as not being part of a session. I would probably have drained pour it for sure. But, as a second beer it?s ok. It?s a shame since I thought the flavor of this one was really good. Anyway, I guess sometimes you gotta stand out and that?s something that we must expect occasionally. Good but far from great because of high sweetness. Doesn?t deserve this hype.
A lot going on here. Bourbon. Syrupy. Coconut. Sticky. Coffee. Boozy. Tasted on deliverance trip.

Bomber poured a clear dark reddish brown with a lasting tan head. Aromas of dark chocolate, coconut, bourbon, oak and light coffee. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of dark chocolate, coconut, bourbon, light coffee and light fruitiness with a smooth lingering chocolate coconut finish.
Bottle shared Here comes the dude of decadence! Insane stuff, thick liquid chocolate cookie, lots of vanilla, coconut and bear hugs (!). Stay away from it, its all mine!!!

Bottle: Poured a black color porter with a large brown foamy head with good retention and some good amount of lacing. Aroma of vanilla and bourbon with some sweet candy-lie notes and faint roasted malt notes is quite pleasant. Taste is a mix of faint roasted malt with plenty of residual sugar notes with light perfumy notes, some vanilla and bourbon notes are also observable. Body is somewhat full with nice creamy texture with good carbonation and no apparent alcohol. The coconut and turpido sugar makes for a very nice dessert type beer but sugar does become overwhelming at some point.

Little head and mild lacing. Coconut aroma. Dark black color. Easy sitting on the tongue. Sweet sugar finish with coconut aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared. Thanks Gregg! Huge milk chocolate nose that just never ends with vanilla and cream with some light coffee and coconut as it warms. Oak undertones pop out on the palate with some bourbon and tons more chocolate. I cant believe this is 15 percent. No alcohol and it drinks like chocolate milk. Alcohol is unbelievably hidden well. Not much else to say besides chocolate and booze hidden. Solid, but definitely a sweet bomb.

How: Bottle.
Where: Sweet & Sour 2016.
Appearance: Black colour with almost no head.
Aroma: Coffee, caramel, vanilla, alcohol, bourbon.
Body: Full body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Sweet malt, chocolate, coffee, coconut, bourbon, some alcohol.

Pours dark, not much carbonation but thats not the point anyway. Aroma is full of vanilla, nice milk chocolate. Tastes like liquid cookie, alcohol is well hidden, no way there is 15 percent of it. Cocoa, chocolate, syrupy and very sweet. Bitterness is coming out in the aftertaste. Best sweet beer I have had.

Over the top sweet coconut and chocolatey nose with vanilla and oak playing in the background. Super big body, tons of coconut, roasted cocunut, chocolate, sweet as hell, lots of nuts, would be awesome with my wifes homemade granola and smells kinda like that, so much chocolate. For 15% it is insanely well hidden, though there is just a bit of a burn. Never cloying, but a bit too sweet, but the depth is incredible.
Nothing like expected. Big coffee nose, which did not disappoint in taste. Big chocolate and some carmel. Sweetness made it so drinkable.

August 20, 2016. Bottle at Sweet & Sour, thanks for sharing! 
Dark brown with a small brownish head. Aroma is sweet, malty, smooth roasted with caramel, sweet blackberries, toasted coconut, bourbon, prunes and hibts of vanilla. 

Taste is sweet, malty, smooth roast, soft bourbon alcohol. Finish is smooth sweet malty caramel, daek sugars, hints of nuts, roasted coffee, milk chocolate, warming bourbon and a juni of toasted coconuts . Medium to full bodied, very smooth, soft carbonation. 
Great, smooth and drinkable.

Bottle at Sweet & Sour 2016 at Sahtipaja, Sätila. Opaque black beer with a nice beige head. Chocolate and coconut aroma, licorice, figs, raisins, some cocoa powder, nuts, some plums. Chocolate and coconut flavor, licorice, cocoa powder, hazelnuts, milk chocolate, figs and raisins, well hidden alcohol. Amazing, I really Love it.
Bottle. Pours pitch black with a small head. Aroma is boozy fruity coconut fruity bready. Flavor is fullbodied velvety a bit char acidy coconut Coffee roasted malts sweetish.... Just lovely

Bottle courtesy of Michael! Thank you! Pours viscous black with a small mocha head that leaves some sparse trace on the glass while dissiapting. Smell is malty with roasted malts, burnt caramel, toffee, charred wood, dark roast coffee, dark chocolate, bbq banana with chocolate syrup, roasted coconut, moist soil and bourbon alcohol. Taste is sweet, bitter, malty and nutty. Mouthfeel is viscous, round, oily, tiny astringent, slightly oily, boozy and near full bodied. Finish is sweet, bitter, malty and nutty with roasted malts, caramel, toffee, coffee, chocolate, coconut, moist soil and bourbon alcohol. Crazy intense and decadently tasty!
A: Pitch black with a off white head N: Coffee, vanilla, dark berries, bourbon T: Vanilla, coffee, molasses, coconut O: WOW! Amazingly complex! Love it!

Bottle at the beach in Nordhouse Dunes Wilderness next to a campfire. Very dark brown with fizzy light brown head. Lots of bourbon and chocolate, coconut, vanilla, coffee, very sugary and boozy. Very sweet and some boozy bitterness. Almost full bodied with fizzy carbonation. Not the ideal circumstances for a beer as it was quite warm so will rerate this later, but I quite enjoyed it then.

650 ml bottle from trade with RobertDale. Thank you Bob!! Black color with beige brown head. Malty aroma, roasted, sweet, chocolate, cocoa, fruity, dark dried fruits, vanilla, spicy like cinnamon, wood, alcohol. Heavy sweet taste like aroma. Almost full silky oily to creamy body with soft carbonation. It gets much better when it warms up.
Incredibly sweet beer, rich as all hell, the coconut is really nice but this beer is a sipper and the taste while very good is not at the level Id expect for a beer with these scores.

Pours a jet black with an off-white head. Aroma is coconut, bourbon, vanilla, roast, and chocolate. Flavor is rich, sweet chocolate, coconut, vanilla, bourbon. Has moderate carbonation and a thick, smooth, chewy body. Delicious.

Shared bottle. This is one of the best porters I have ever quaffed. Dense and turbid blackish pour with little head. Nose was intense dark malt, oaky bourbon, coconut. Tasted rich, dense, with heavy oak, bourbon, dark malt, molasses, and mild nutty flavors throughout. Delicious.

Bottle sampled at the As Is Bottleshare #1. Courtesy of MikeM (thank you sir!) Pours a rich brown body with no head, minor off white lacing. Nose is pretty muted for the most part. Mouthfeel is medium bodied (a bit fuller bodied compared to other imperial porters in recent memory) with notes of sweet Vietnamese coffee, sugar, cream, lactose and marshmallows. Good stuff, albeit a bit too sweet.

Large shared bottle.
Very sweet yet somehow not cloying. Still a bit too sweet for me and, surely, some others.
Very good, moderate use of bourbon barrel aging.

Bottle. Pours a cola color with a small beige head. Aromas of spices, sweet malts, bourbon. Taste is medium+ sweet with complex spices. Bitter roasted malts become apparent on the back end. Complex spices last well into the finish. Medium bodied, average carbonation, astringent finish.
Bottle shared at Todds. Medium body with a big taste of maple syrup throughout. Bourbon and some coconut on finish.
Bottle - pours dark brown. Lots of coconut in the nose, slight bourbon. Taste was roasted chocolate, coconut, very sweet.

This bottled brew from a rating party poured a head of foamy finely sized tan colored bubbles that were quickly diminishing and left behind a no visible carbonation opaque dark black brown colored body and a fair lacing. The nice aroma was brown malt roasted malt sweet and dark malt. The vinous thick mouth feel was very tingly at the start and at the finish with a strong dark malt aftertaste. The yummy flavor contained notes of roasted malt vinous toasted malt brown malt dark malt and hops. A wonderful best in class brew.
22oz via trade. Nose is pure coconut. Taste is sweet. Low carb. Barrel is not overly assertive. Kind of thin but sweet. Chugs pretty good.
Dark brown pour. Nose is a coconut bomb. Taste is very sweet coconut, molasses, just very very sweet. Not at all hot for a beer of such high abv. Sticky thin mouthfeel.

Pours an opaque dark brown color with minimal khaki colored head. Bourbon, chocolate, coconut, oak, sweetness, and some light roast notes on the nose; follows onto the palate. Full bodied. Finishes with much of the same. In addition, the alcohol is well hidden, does not drink like it is 15%.

Glass, 4-ounce, draught, during the Festival of Barrel-Aged Beers, savoured on November 21 2015; eye: black, opaque, ring of brown head, no lacing; nose: roasted barley, chocolate, coconut, maple, bourbon, light woody, cinnamon; mouth: roasted barley, chocolate, coconut, maple, bourbon, light woody, cinnamon, vegetables, finale in cinnamon with presence of bourbon, full body, good carbonation, mildly sweet, lightly bitter, lightly alcoholic texture; overall: nice surprise

FRANÇAIS

Verre, 4 onces, en fût, durant le Festival of Barrel-Aged Beers, savourée le 21 novembre 2015; il : noire, opaque, anneau de mousse brun, pas de dentelle; nez : orge torréfiée, chocolat, noix de coco, érable, bourbon, léger boisé, cannelle; bouche : orge torréfiée, chocolat, noix de coco, érable, bourbon, léger boisé, cannelle, légumes, finale en cannelle avec présence de bourbon, corsée, bonne carbonatation, moyennement sucrée, légèrement amère, texture légèrement alcoolique; en résumé : belle surprise
On tap at Crunchy's. One of the best beers I've ever had. So chocolate with sweet and a hint of the bourbon. So silky in mouthfeel.

Had batch 1 on NYE and it was my favorite beer of the year. Had batch 2 with the purple ball and it was just as amazing this time around! Very sweet and huge on the coconut. As it warms the bourbon comes around with what seems like a nice touch of cinnamon. Deceptive ABV as this one is very easy drinking. What a dangerous and delightful brew we have here.

Bottle thanks to Jeremy. Pours black with tan head that lasts. The aroma is strong coconut, pure sugar, bourbon, wood, milk chocolate. Thick mouth, chewy, milk chocolate, coconut, nice booze but not overpowering, really enjoyed this, calmer than you...calmer than you.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2016 Tap at Clubhouse BFD. Pours dark black, big tan head. Creamy. Aroma is bourbon, butterscotch, vanilla, toffee, coffee. Wow. Flavor is insanely smooth bourbon, really intense, but so good and balanced, coffee is intense, some cinnamon. Wow, this is so amazing. It?s sweet, but it?s really doing it for me.

Bomber. Pours black with tan head. Aroma is sweet chocolate coconut bourbon. Taste is just like the aroma. Super sweet chocolate coconut bourbon with a warm bourbon coconut finish. I love it and glad i do as i had to trade for it to get it here in CO.
Bottle. Black pour with brown head. Roasted, chocolate, vanilla, sweet aromas. Flavors are bold, coffee, vanilla and booze.

Wow, thats really all I can say. Well not all because I dont give crappy rates like fluffy. Pours jet black with a thick mocha head. Aroma of coconut, bourbon, milk chocolate and maple. Taste follows, sweet maple bourbon, molasses, coconut and milk chocolate. Sweet and chewy. This is a dessert beer that I wish I could have all the time. This is simply amazing, I am out of words to explain how amazing this beer is.

Bottle thanks to BA trade. Nose is huge in fudge and milk chocolate. lots of vanilla. smells like a whoppers ball. fucken grate. taste is a light fudge and vanilla explosion of awesomeness. lots of decadent cocoa and yummy. aye.

(22oz bomber) deep brown, fine tan bubbles. Nose of coconut, barrel, coffee, milk chocolate, complex and awesome. Taste of runny caramel, milk chocolate, rich coconut, coffee, rich and decadent, no attention given to any roasty characteristics. Just delicious. Medium thick body and excellent coconut and chocolate linger.
Bottle: Poured a black with red edges, head was just bubbles. Aroma was nice bourbon, vanilla and coconut. Taste bourbon, coconut, vanilla, molasses, and warming booze.
Amazing fucking beer. Creamy coconut vanilla aroma. Sweet. Black pour from 22oz bottle at home. Cherry, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg and cocoa. Nibs. Coconut dominates. So good. Top 10
Aroma is cinnamon vanilla Flavor is somewhat sweet, vanilla. Perfectly balanced and it hides the booze perfectly. from 2015. Pours reddish brown with a thin cream head. Awesome porter

Bottle courtesy of Kermis. Poured a murky dark brown with a thin broken off white head. The aroma is sweet toffee caramel, vanilla, alcohol. The flavour is moderate to strong sweet with a super rich sweet malt, heart warming alcohol, light coconut palate. Full to medium bodied with soft carbonation.

66cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis. 
Thin tan head. Clear black pour. Coffee sweet oak aftertaste. Very good

Bottle shared. Black with a small tan head. Aroma of bourbon, oak, chocolate, coffee, coffee, fudge, toffee, floral almost, candy and molasses. Flavour is heavy sweet. Full bodied with a thick chewy mouthfeel, alcohol warmth in the finish and soft carbonation.
Very good Porter. Im not sure whats so Vietnamese about it but I like it. Smooth and tastes great!  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

640 ML bottle

Light black with a lot of ruby. Light tan head that fell to a good ringed collar. BIG AVB legs. 
Nose is bourbon, coconut, vanilla (sweet nose up front), coffee, earth and dark fruits. Amazing nose, Got even better when the bourbon faded off and left the dark fruits to almost stand alone. 
Taste is pretty much the carbon copy of the nose. Superb taste to this. Very well balanced and each ingredient really shines well. Sweet and slick beer. Light carbonation. Near perfect for how big this puppy is.

Bomber. Pours a deep and dark black with small khaki head. Aromas of bourbon, coffee, chocolate, molasses, and vanilla. Flavor is bourbon booze up front, coffee, vanilla, molasses, coconut, wood. Big and bold body, thick creamy texture, average carbonation, and an alcohol burn to finish.

[1/30/16] Bottle sample at the Encomium bottle share, after RateBeer Best awards ceremony at Hyatt Vineyard Creek Hotel in Santa Rosa. Thanks everyone who shared bottles! Dark brown. Chocolate, nuts, sweet, some dark fruits.

Matthew graciously left this beer in my fridge for me to enjoy. Big time want of mine. Dark brown body with a tan collar. Lovely aroma of coffee, oak, bourbon, chocolate. The flavor is phenomenal. Robust and bold with elegant and silky smoothness. A world class beer.
Great beer. A tad sweet for my liking but overall great. Really nice flavor as it warmed
Bottle - Boozy roast and bourbon notes. Deep brown and a light brown head, nice sweetness, coffee and a touch of milky sweetness. Very sweet and nice.
Thanks Mark for sharing this 12oz bottle. The little lebowski has a great nose-sweet -molasses/bourbon-dk malt, some bourbon. T-follows, slight alcohol shows.

Wow. Thanks to goryskewych for the bottle. Pours a deep stout brown with a tan head. Nose is bourbon, coconut, oak, vanilla, goodness, and. Hint of unicorn tears. Flavor is bourbon, oak, coconut, vanilla, goodness, molasses, and booze. Medium in body and be vanilla, oak, and bourbon in the finish. Delicious beer.

22 oz. bottle, pours black with a reddish tinge and a small tan head. Aroma brings out notes of lactose, bourbon and a little cocoa - very little roast. Flavour is complex as hell, with notes of coconut, vanilla and brown sugar upfront, followed by bourbon barrels. Alcohol is not apparent at all. Sweet, but not cloying. Fantastic stuff.

22 ounce bottle into snifter, bottled in summer 2015. Pours nearly opaque dark brown/black color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big milk chocolate, caramel, coconut, vanilla, toffee, brown sugar, toasted oak, bourbon, maple, molasses, light cocoa/coffee, light raisin/fig, and oak/toasted earthiness. Fantastic aromas with awesome balance and complexity of dark/roasted malt, coconut/brown sugar, and bourbon barrel notes; with good strength. Taste of huge milk chocolate, caramel, coconut, vanilla, toffee, brown sugar, toasted oak, bourbon, maple, molasses, light cocoa/coffee, light raisin/fig, and oak/toasted earthiness. Moderate bourbon/oak spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of milk chocolate, caramel, coconut, vanilla, toffee, brown sugar, toasted oak, bourbon, maple, molasses, light raisin/fig, and oak/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roasted malt, coconut/brown sugar, and bourbon barrel flavors; with an incredible malt/oak spiciness balance and zero cloying sweetness after the finish. Some light-moderate dryness from oak spiciness after the finish. Light-medium carbonation and medium-full body; with a very smooth, creamy/silky, and lightly sticky mouthfeel that is fantastic. Alcohol is very well hidden with light-moderate warming and zero booziness after the finish. Overall this is a world class imperial porter style. All around incredible complexity and perfect balance of dark/roasted malt, coconut/brown sugar, and bourbon barrel flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the enormous ABV. An insanely mind blowing offering.
Poured a deep dark brown we it a beige head. Aroma was of char, oak, coconut and booze. Flavor had some chocolate, booze, barrel and coconut. Pretty good.

Draft pour on tap at FoBAB 2015 at UIC Forum (Chicago, IL). Pours a deeper blackish brown hue, some brownish glow on the edges with a firmer hazed middle. Frothy lighter brown head is firmer, thick ringer with good lacing. Aromas are sweet, maple and brown sugar meet a jab of honey, caramel, a bit nutty and firmer maple elements. Coconut, caramel, and oak. A gentle warmth. Initial mirrors this, a bit flabby and definitely sweet. Caramel, maple, nuts meet brown sugar, oak and a gentle warmth and tannic appeal. Firmer coconut, more toffee and sweetness, toast and melllow roast. A bit sweet, tangy and tannic as we round the corner. Firmer barrel, the coconut hangs on and integrates into it. Oaky, some sporit and roast appeal. A bit sweet and sticky up front but a more assertive barrel into the finish. A bit messy but a fun experience.

22 oz. bomber split 2 ways. Pours a dark-brown, semi-translucent with a rising brown head that fades to little more than a ring. Aromas of sweet bourbon and oak upfront, with soy sauce, vanilla, dark fruits and light chocolate. Not much coconut on the nose. Taste was extremely sweet out of the gate with lots of soy sauce underlying throughout. Vanilla and light coconut come through the mid-palate with a hefty dose of astringent booze and char. Was hoping for a thicker mouth feel here, but this comes off as thin for the ABV. The alcohol is very noticeable throughout....even with the massive amount of sticky sugar clinging to my palate. This was a fun beer to try but far to over the top with sugar and booze for me to drink much more than a few ounces of it.
Gifted from Harwell. Great beer. Wow. Creamy, rich, bourbon, chocolate, vanilla. This is seriously a big beer. Awesome.

Many thanks to Rian (Thirstybird ) for sharing this beast of a beer. Almost black with a lively tan collar. Strong aroma of coffee, chocolate, coconut and booze. Initially a little cloying, but after some of the previous hop forward beers in our tasting, this was only to be expected. The promised coffee and coconut came through in abundance, fuelled by an almost burning alcohol. Sadly, just as I was getting really tuned in this splendid Imperial Porter, I had to make a dash to catch the last train home. The flavour and warming booziness was still with me when I got to bed an hour later. I must get a hip flask for similar scenarios. World class.

Many thanks to ThirstyBird for sharing! Extremely deep and thick. Dark milk chocolate. Coconut, roasted malt. Thick and viscous. Completely complex, sweet but not too. Great deep chocolate aftertaste. Melting chocolate with a round smooth body. Fascinating stuff!!

Thanks to my sweet sister for getting this for me! Pours an opaque near black color with a light tan head. The smell is dark malt, dark fruit, coconut, molasses. The taste is sweet coconut, dark malt, roast, some boozey sweetness ending roasty with some fruity crispness lingering. Very full bodied with tight carbonation. Very flavorful stuff!

Draft to taster at FoBAB 15 from notes. Pours dark brown to black in color with a medium sized tan head. The aroma and flavor have big coconut, vanilla, bourbon, chocolate, cinnamon, caramel, some booze though I wouldnt have guessed 15%, sweet, decadent dessert like beer, one of the bigger ones we had this year.
Bottle. Dark brown pour with a kaki head. Mild bourbon bouquet. Lots of caramel, coconut, chocolate, bourbon, oak, and vanilla notes. Good body and mouthfeel.

650 mL bottle. Black with a lot of transparency. Medium khaki head. Big coconut aroma. Light creaminess. Nutty. Some bourbon. Extremely sweet taste. Huge coconut. And then more sugar and caramel. Nutty with some milk chocolate. Really boozy. Excessively sweet and alcoholic. I get the hype. The sweet coconut really overwhelms everything. I struggled through a substantial pour of this.

Pours pitch black with a thin brown head. Aroma: Bourbon, coconut, molasses and oak. Taste:Bourbon, coconut, cinnamon and molasses. Palate:full bodied. low carbonation, Sticky. slick. finish starts of a little boozy then has a lasting light bitter finish. Overall: anyone who likes barrel aged stouts or porters, this is a must have. Its so good that I cannot say I have had anything better. It is sweet and a little boozy. You would not guess it at 15 abv though. When you love beer, this is one of the beers that life is made of.

Draft to taster at FoBAB 2015 pour opaque black with large tan head. Nose bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, mild cinnamon. Taste super sweet, maple syrup, light chocolate. Cinnamon and coconut in the mid with a light cinnamon finish.

Bomber, assumedly recent, shared by WillRunforbeer on 11/28/15.Dark mahogany/ebony pour has a tan head that is small and shows moderate to low retention. Did not check clarity.Hugely rich, almost candy-sweet nose does not burn with alcohol, but seems quite estery. Coconut adds to the overall rich/sweet character and the turbinado fermentation adds more esters and candy character. Bourbon is notable, but not overdone, with prominent spice and vanilla emerging. Dosent smell as much like an Imperial Stout/Porter so much as it does a big huge barleywine. Kind of like an amped up JW Lees, or something like that (with bourbon and coconut).Rich, strong, sweet, candyish and estery/fruity in the mouth, it has a massively soft, sugary texture, though the alcohol prevents it from being syrupy or cloying. Difficult to rate, as its not "overdone" in the usual sense of an Imperial. The barrel aging is done pretty well, its not a booze bomb, especially given the massive abv and its not underfermented. But I just dont think theres quite enough dry/acidc balance to it (some tannin and heavy toasted oak lingers, but not exactly pleasantly). If youre putting a beer in a bourbon barrel, why are you also adding coconut? Furthermore, why the hell do you need to turbinado this thing up to 15% abv??? Jesus christ, isnt 12% way more than enough??

Pours a night black color, with a surprisingly huge, bubbly mohagony head.

Smells of an earth supported, profound cinnamon spiciness, together with sweet, slightly wooden coconut, toasted pecans and a whiff of lemon peel. These aromas blend into burned toffee, tied together by bakers chocolate and raisins. Its sweet qualities turn quite distinct, topped off by molasses, which get balanced by a rich bourbon soaked appearance, adding vanilla and a warming punch to the nose.

Has a lower carbonation, with a luscious smoothness to it, showcasing the beers huge body beautifully, while finishing with a great blend of spicy, bourbon soaked truffles.

Mirrors the spicy truffle impression from the nose, while adding a fair amount of scorched malts and walnut shells to it. Its malt qualities are multi layered, very rich, to be able to balance the beers bourbon quality, revealing toffee, caramel and molasses, tied together by roasted coconut. Bourbon adds a flowery vanilla flavor, blending perfectly into the already established cinnamon woodeness, enriching the beer by a hot wood bark note, adding a pungent dryness to the sweetness. Finishes outstandingly smooth, with boozy, chocolate coated caramel and lots of whipped cream. 

Its smoothness balances the hot bourbon bite easily, while providing well fitting adjuncts, coming together due to a rich maltiness. While this is certainly a sipper, it reveals its huge abv only embedded in the warming, flowery Bourbon barrel.

650 ml bottle shared by Willrunforbeer, much thanks. Black color, almost no head. Aroma is a hefty amount of bourbon with wood and lasting coconut, cinnamon.
The flavor shows a great myriad of flavors. Vanilla, cinnamon, oak and a nice melded bourbon. Damn the mouthfeel is awesome!! Oily with a mild bourbon burn. The ABV is almost totally hidden and for the 15 % is really amazing. Just a really off the wall full of flavor kind of Porter, unreal.

Bottle from trade with umich03jm. Thanks, Jason! Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is chocolate, coconut, cinnamon, a hint of bourbon. Flavor is nice, full and smooth for 15%. Dark chocolate, coffee, coconut, cinnamon, mild barrel. World class.

Bomber. Thanks WillRun for bringing this bomb. Stoked to try it. 

A - The appearance is like an oily and slick black...not a thick mess but its really good looking. A nice dark tan head. 

S - This is a coconut bomb. I absolutely think it smells stupid good. table sugar, cinnamon, brown sugar, coconut and vanilla.

T - Thick, like a chocolate cake dessert with toasted coconut and a lot of bakers chocolate with a little bit of brown sugar at the finish. Loaded with flavor and vanilla...but for 15% beer, the booze isnt even present. Its just very refined. 

M - oily and thin then boom, this dense finish. like its sneaking up on you like a Ninja.

O - Yeah man, Id love more of this...maybe not a keg but a case of this would be great.

Poured from bottle thanks Willrunforbeer dark chocolate pour with a tan lacey head. Aromas of vanilla coffee coconut and bourbon. Taste is awesome nice rich creamy mouth feel brown sugar and hint of cinnamon.
Black pour with tan head. Aroma is vanilla and bourbon. Flavor is super smooth roasty with bourbon and coconut coming through. Lots of vanilla. So smooth. Like this a lot.  THANKS BRIAN!
On tap at FOBAB 2015. Score and notes from notepad. Poured black with off tan head. Aroma sweet spicy vanilla, min coconut. Light carb med bod. Taste min bourbon coconut sweeeet.
On tap at FoBAB. Pours a dark brown black with minimal head. Aromas of sweet coffee and coconut. Caramel. The taste is sweet but not overly so. Quite smooth. Medium body.
22oz red waxed bomber shared by Dan. Poured out pitch black with a small creamy tan head. Aroma and taste of bourbon, oak, rich toffee, hints of coconut, and some warming alcohol burn.

On draft at HopCat in Ann Arbor. In prep for Rare Day tomorrow. The pour is a pitch black, oily and no head. There is a little wispy lace as it empties. The aroma is heavy booze. It's a bit to get past that. Lots of coconut and barrel influence on this one. The cinnamon comes through on the back end. It smells sweet. Almost like a syrup. Brown sugar and molasses is present in the back end. The flavor is good. The cinnamon really pops on the flavor. The coconut takes a back seat and it's a little more bracing and bitter than the scent leads on. The mouth feel is thin. It pours much thicker than it feels. There is a decent carbonation but it falls off the tongue and out of the mouth quickly. Aftertaste is lingeringly sweet cinnamon. Pretty good. Finally got to try it!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from mikem409, thanks for the opportunity!
Solid dark black with the faintest of garnet at the edges and a bubbly off white head that shows poor retention. Brown sugary, fruity syrup, roast with hints of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, and light coconut. A bit sticky and syrupy with a nice warming alcohol. A sipper for sure, but hides the alcohol well, I wish Id waited for a cold winter night for this.

Bomber shared by Dan. Poured a medium viscosity super dark blackish-brown with a smaller tight foamy beige. Aroma is burnt buttered waffles with maple syrup, yup that about covers it. Flavor is the same with some more burnt notes. Solid beer

A- pours an opaque cola brown with a very light khaki head that does not linger. Dainty lacing. 

S- brown sugar, cookie batter, butterscotch, vanilla beans, brownies are all soooooooo delectable. Some bourbon, roasted malts and oak with the coconut. Cola and sharp grasses that give it an underlying bitterness. Light mince meat spices. 

M- medium oily to watery body. Very light carb.

T- warm alcohol, bourbon, bakers chocolate, mocha and honey up front. Warm raspberries, vanilla and toffee. Grasses, graham crackers and tart Meyers lemons. More RC cola. Molasses as it warms. Light chalk. Ending has a more pronounced grass, lemon and zinc.
22oz bottle pours a dark brown color with a bit of head. Surprising amount of head for this high abv. Mild coffee and coconut. Smooth bourbon.
Bottle..Pour is black with a tan head...Nose is cream, roast, chocolate, bourbon..Taste is bourbon, chocolate, butterscotch, chocolate, spice...

Bottle and draft. The pour is black. The aroma is sweet sweet bourbon. The taste is very smooth. Big up front, and finishes with a slight burn. This one stacks up to the best of them. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle share at Toms house. One of the first beers was this badass. Small snifter pour was jet black with small mocha head. Very powerful aroma of dark chocolate, vanilla, oak barrel, roasted malts, smores, and light bourbon. The taste was superb with the dark chocolate and marshmallow creating an almost smores-like taste. You barely get the 15% ABV as it is not overpowering at all. You do get the oak barrel and the sweet finish like a dessert. Large body, lighter carb. Fucking great!

Bottle: &nbsp Deep cola, sudsy dark beige head, spotty lacing. &nbsp Bourbon nose, vanilla, graham cracker, with lots of toasted marshmallows. &nbsp Similar on the tongue, very warming. &nbsp Big Bourbon notes. &nbsp Imperial Porter is secondary. &nbsp Very sweet but not cloying. &nbsp This one is tasty! &nbsp Moderate to full body and mouthfeel. &nbsp Lots of Vanilla, graham cracker, and toasted marshmallow on the finish. &nbsp This was a great beer! &nbsp Thanks Kevin!

Dark pour with a tiny head and softer carbonation. Taste and aroma of whiskey, raisin, vanilla, coconut, roasted malt. Medium body with a sticky mouthfeel, the 15% alcohol is not prominent in the aroma or taste but will sneak up on you fast. Huge thanks to Marc!

(bottle - 22 oz) Dark black pour with a thin tan head. Lots of coffee and alcohol in the aroma with hints of the bourbon barrel it sat in. Flavor is sweet and bitter at the start, no coconut that I could find, but lots of vanilla notes from the barrel. Smooth and not as hot as I thought 15% would be. [9/9/15]
Shared bottle. Pours almost black with a nice tan head. Aroma of malt, chocolate, bourbon, and vanilla. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, coffee, and some coconut. Delicious++!

Pour out of 750 mL bottle, big thanks for the hookup! Dark black pour with fizzy off white head, aroma brought notes of big dark chocolate, bourbon, lots of coconut into some vanilla, oak, touch of spice, brownie. Taste was a mix of oak, vanilla, big cocoa, lots of coconut into some bourbon, slight booze, touch of cocoa nib, coffee, finishing fairly sweet. Kind of like a thin version of bcbs with coconut, pretty tasty.
Bomber. Coconut, almost prop 13 levels. Touch of cinnamon. Chocolate. Doesnt seem anywhere close to 15%, a bit thin for such a big beer but otherwise amazing.
Very dark brown, somewhat opaque, thin brown lacing. Coconut, caramel, fudge, and oak barrel. Sweet and coconutty. Slick mouthfeel, moderate viscosity, full bodied, and smooth. Long sugary finish.
Draft at Shakespeare's Kalamazoo. Rich vanilla bourbon aroma. Pitch black. Faint ring of head. Rich, oily thick consistency, sweet coconut, vanilla awesomeness.
22oz bottle pours a dark black with a tan khaki head, slight taste of vanilla coconut and bourbon.
Pours a nice black with tan head. Nose full of coconut and slight Vanilla. Nice booze and coconut flavor. Very Sweet and Nice mouthfeel. flavor improves as it warms.

Bottle thanks to Steve (Red Beard). Color is black very thin, wispy head. Big chocolate coconut aroma, sweet and sticky, bakery smells.Very thick, sticky mouth fell with a lot of coconut, chocolate, like eating coconut brownies tasty!

Bottle thanks to red beard. Pours out black topped with a tan head. Nose is great roast malts vanilla tasted coconut and bourbon barrel. Taste is amazing sweetness chocolate marshmallow vanilla tons of coconut and a great end. Very nice for my sweet tooth.
Bottle to glass. Pours black with tan head. Aroma is coconut and booze. Taste is sweet, coconut, booze. Good beer, booze hits after it warms up.

Aroma is coffee, booze, sweet malt. Appearance is dark dark brown, light tan head slightly thin. Taste is maple, coffee, sweet, and coconut. Mouthfeel is a touch thin, but great carbonation saving it. Overall, very impressive offering.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2016 Bottle. Thanks Miguel! Aroma is huge coconut, moderate chocolate syrup, molasses, oak, and light alcohol. Tastes moderately sweet. Loads of coconut, some raises, chocolate, and bourbon, light cinnamon and other spices. Thin to medium body. Drinks easier than 15% but the alcohol is noticeable when it warms. Solid but I wish there was something to balance the sweetness. Could use more body too. Re-rate 9/26/15. Tap at The Oak. I may have been a little harsh on the first rate. Its still a little too sweet and thin but it tastes great. So much coconut. Its like drinking a coconut dessert. Im going to bump this a little. Original rate was 3.7. Re-rate 3/1/16 - Ok Im giving in now. Had this three more times on tap. Sweetness no longer bothers me and the alcohol taste is gone completely which is very impressive. Its just booze and coconut with light chocolate and maple. Awesome really. Could be up there with my favorites if it had some body.

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2015 Bottle. Pours dark brown with tan head. Nose/taste of coconut, bourbon, dark sugar, oak, cinnamon, coffee and exotic spices- A bit of booze in finish - Medium bodied. Boozy dark sugar dominates the palate.

Aroma is huge chocolate, coconut, cinnamon, and coffee. Taste is a blend of the aromas and it works very well... Hope they continue to put this one out, amazing

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle given to me by a friend. Dark brown pour with a medium tan head. Aroma of malt, chocolate, walnut and dark fruit. Chocolate flavor with candied walnuts before a maple syrup and bourbon finish. Very nice.

Aroma of milk chocolate, toffee, maple syrup, butterscotch, some tangy apple, and a touch of dark roast malt. Appears like coffee with a thick ring of off white foam. Taste is very sweet, could be more balanced, needs something to bitter it a bit more. Oily texture. Overall, very unbalanced; it has some nice flavors, but it is just overwhelmingly sweet for me.

Bottle. Dark black. Nice tan head. Nose is raisiny malts, chocolate, bourbon. Rich body. Very sweet. Milk chocolate, bourbon, roasty malt. Very light for ABV. Baltic porter qualities. Didnt catch much coconut, but be warned: coconut allergy? Youll get a reaction from this.
UPDATED: SEP 9, 2015 Coconut nose and lots of coconut flavor. Poor?s dark with a tanish head. Bourbon adds s nice complexity. Perrin just made itself legit.
Bottle at Crunchy's. Candi, wood, molasses , coffee, chocolate, coconut. Smooth, boozy, and outstanding.

12oz bottle. Pours deep rich mahogany, pretty clear with a small tan head that dissipates to a ring with nice lacing. Aroma is really delicate with coconut, vanilla and bourbon all present, with some cocoa. Flavor is fairly sweet, medium bitter, holy coconut batman. LOADS of the white stuff in this one, bourbon provides a really nice accent but not over the top. Vanilla compliments the coconut with a bit of roast poking through at well. There is some heat, but given the ABV, it does not seem bad at all. Some oaky astringency on the finish is perhaps the only real detractor from this tasty beer. Medium body with a soft mouthfeel. Yep, the hype is real. Who the hell is Perrin?
UPDATED: OCT 2, 2015 Bottle. Thanks b3shine. Color is black very thin head. Big chocolate coconut aroma. Taste is very thick mouth fell with loads of coconut. Brownies and fudge.

Bottle- aroma is huge coffee, coconut, vanilla, chocolate, and bourbon. Taste is awesome; huge chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, and coffee flavors. Some maple, coconut, and soy sauce. A little smoke or could be chard oak. Cant believe this is 15 percent, a lot of similarities to bcbs. lives up to hype.

Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate maple syrup, coconut, lighter vanilla, chocolate, molasses, mint, light coffee, and oak. It pours a dark brown with barely some orange highlights. It has a two finger beige head that eventually settles to a thin film outlined by a thicker ring. There is some sporadic webbing left on the sides of the glass. The flavor starts with some sugary chocolate and maple syrup. Theres some light molasses in the background. The finish has light-moderate roasted malt, coconut, bourbon, vanilla, a touch of oak, and mint. Its medium bodied with soft carbonation and a somewhat sticky mouthfeel. Overall, this is pretty sweet. Its sweet enough to convince you its 15%, but theres no heat here at all. While I wouldnt go so far to say this should be a nip bottle dessert beer along the lines of how Black Tuesday should be packaged...a 22 oz bottle is too much. Knock this down to 12oz bottles.

Bomber to snifter. Looks good; a slightly translucent dark cola with fizzy beige head. Smells good too; malty with notes of coconut, oak, maple syrup, and a touch of bourbon. Tastes like it smells with a silky smooth mouthfeel that drinks like half its abv. Wow!
Sweet coconut, coffee, maple all blending together to make this one outstanding beverage! 15% is so well hidden, this could be dangerous. Best new stout from Michigan this year!

Draft. Pours black. Aroma and taste are an amazingly balanced blend of coffee, maple, and bourbon. This is far and beyond anything Perrins ever done before, and is better than KBS and Black Note as far as Michigan beers go. 
Side note - Ill take my wife shopping on Alpine just to get over to Perrin for a glass of this stuff.
Tap. Black with small head. This is amazing. Very rich and malty. Chocolate. Sweet maple and coffee. Flavors blend so well. Almost no booze, which seems unreal. Fantastic.
